name: Button

jtbd.functional: Submit actions, trigger operations, and navigate between views. The primary interactive element for user-initiated actions.
jtbd.affordance: Universally recognized interactive element — filled, outlined, or ghost variants communicate hierarchy. Users immediately understand this is clickable and will produce an action.
jtbd.emotional: Confidence through responsiveness. The active-state scale and loading spinner confirm the system received the action.

anatomy.button: .t-btn — The button element itself. Inline-flex container with centered content, density-aware padding.
anatomy.icon: .t-btn > svg/img — Optional leading or trailing icon, sized to match text
anatomy.label: .t-btn > span — Button text label, semibold weight, tight leading

visual.primary: .t-btn--primary — Filled with brand color. Use for primary actions (1 per view).
visual.secondary: .t-btn--secondary — Outlined with brand border. Use for secondary actions.
visual.ghost: .t-btn--ghost — No background or border. Use for tertiary/inline actions.
visual.danger: .t-btn--danger — Filled with danger color. Use for destructive actions.

size.sm: .t-btn--sm — Compact size for dense UIs (reduced padding, xs text).
size.default: No modifier — standard 44px min-height, sm text.
size.lg: .t-btn--lg — Large size for hero CTAs (increased padding, base text).

state.icon-only: .t-btn--icon — Square button with icon only, equal padding.

accessibility.ariaDisabled: Use aria-disabled='true' instead of disabled attribute when button should remain in tab order
accessibility.keyboard: Enter and Space activate. Tab navigates. No keyboard trap.
accessibility.screenReader: Button label announced with role. Loading state should announce via aria-live or aria-busy.
accessibility.motionReduced: Active-state scale and loading spinner animation disabled under prefers-reduced-motion

knownIssues: Loading spinner uses currentcolor which may not be visible on all variants
No aria-busy attribute set during loading state — requires JS
Icon-only variant needs aria-label — CSS cannot enforce
futureConsiderations: Button group component for related actions
